alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 1:35AM EDT until July 14 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Upton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Orange County in southeastern New York... * Until 445 AM EDT. * At 135 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Middletown, Monroe, Warwick, Goshen, Chester, Florida, Harriman, Kiryas Joel, Woodbury, Scotchtown, Mechanicstown, Washingtonville, Maybrook, Pine Island, Highland Mills, Central Valley and New Hampton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
